question: The variance of the original flat distribution from which random numbers are generated is 1/12. If you generate 12 independent numbers, what will be the variance of their sum?
solution:
The variance of the sum of independent random variables is the sum of their variances. Since each of the 12 numbers has a variance of 1/12, the variance of their sum is:

\[
\text{Variance of sum} = 12 \times \frac{1}{12} = 1
\]

Thus, the variance of the sum of the 12 independent numbers is 

\[
\boxed{1}
\]
